an10.4:1.1: There Venerable Sāriputta addressed the mendicants …
an10.4:1.2: “Reverends, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for having no regrets.
an10.4:1.3: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has destroyed a vital condition for joy. …
an10.4:1.4: One who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an10.4:1.5: Suppose there was a tree that lacked branches and foliage. Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would not grow to fullness.
an10.4:1.6: In the same way, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for having no regrets.
an10.4:1.7: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has destroyed a vital condition for joy. …
an10.4:1.8: One who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an10.4:2.1: An ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for not having regrets.
an10.4:2.2: When there are no regrets, one who has no regrets has fulfilled a vital condition for joy. …
an10.4:2.3: One who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an10.4:2.4: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage. Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would grow to fullness.
an10.4:2.5: In the same way, an ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for not having regrets.
an10.4:2.6: When there are no regrets, one who has no regrets has fulfilled a vital condition for joy. …
an10.4:2.7: One who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.”
